Title: A Review on Machine Learning Strategies for Real-World Engineering Applications
Institutions: University Arts, Sciences and Technology, Computer Science Department, Beirut, Lebanon
Image Captions: World wide trend analysis on machine learning techniques.
Page Summaries: This page is a review article from the Babylonian Journal of Machine Learning. It explores various machine learning strategies for real-world engineering applications, discussing the impact of Industry 5.0 and the significance of data in creating intelligent systems. The review highlights different machine learning techniques, including reinforcement learning, semi-supervised learning, unsupervised learning, and supervised learning, and their roles in engineering applications. The paper aims to serve as a comprehensive reference for using machine learning to build intelligent data-processing systems across multiple real-time engineering domains.

This page from the Babylonian Journal of Machine Learning discusses different types of machine learning techniques. These techniques include supervised learning, unsupervised learning, reinforcement learning, and semi-supervised learning. Each type is briefly explained along with its applications. The page also includes a graph showing worldwide trends in the usage of these techniques.

The page discusses the applications of machine learning, highlighting its vast capabilities and practical uses in industries such as computer vision, natural language processing, predictive analytics, and robotics. It also portrays the future potential and growth of machine learning in various fields. There are two images depicting machine learning techniques and their applications.

This page discusses recent works on real-time engineering applications, focusing on intelligent tutoring systems (ITS) and machine learning in healthcare. It details the various applications of ITS, such as student modeling, feedback generation, content creation, and predictive analytics. Additionally, it explores machine learning in healthcare, covering precision medicine, medical imaging diagnosis, patient risk analytics, drug discovery, and virtual health assistants.

The page explores the challenges and future research directions in machine learning, emphasizing explainable AI, data efficiency, ethics and fairness, security and robustness, and distributed machine learning. The conclusion summarizes the comprehensive overview of machine learning techniques, their applications in real-time engineering systems, and the major challenges related to transparency, bias, privacy, security, and scalability. The text aims to inspire future research to enhance machine learning for smarter, self-learning, real-time engineering solutions. It also includes references and acknowledges the institution's support.

This page is a list of references from a journal article or paper, citing various sources about machine learning algorithms, intelligent tutoring systems, deep learning applications in healthcare, artificial intelligence in disease diagnosis, software engineering for machine learning, explainable artificial intelligence, and decentralized algorithms. It highlights key publications and research work in these domains.
